Are all right views the factor of enlightenment that is investigation of dharmas?
Question:
Why is this treatise composed?
Answer:
The previous treatise is the fundamental basis for this treatise.
The previous one states:
What is seeing?ğŸ”½What is knowledge?
What is wisdom?
But it does not state:
Are all right views the factor of enlightenment that is investigation of dharmas?
Because the previous statement is the fundamental basis for this treatise, it is now composed in order to explain it in detail.
In this Abhidharma, there is this definitive characteristic:
If the factors of enlightenment are followed by the factors of the path, it should be known that the factors of the path are entirely uncontaminated;
If the factors of enlightenment are explained after the factors of the path, then one should know that the factors of the path are both contaminated and uncontaminated.
Here, because the factors of enlightenment are explained after the factors of the path, one should know that the factors of the path are both contaminated and uncontaminated.
There may be right view that is not the factor of enlightenment of investigation of principles, and so on, making four alternatives in full.
Right view that is not the factor of enlightenment of investigation of principles refers to mundane right view.
Why is this?
Because the factors of enlightenment are exclusively uncontaminated.
The factor of enlightenment of investigation of principles that is not right view refers to the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonproduction.
Why is this?
Because they lack the aspect of view.

Right view that is also the factor of enlightenment of investigation of principles refers to all remaining uncontaminated discernment, excluding the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonproduction.
What are they?
They refer to the various forbearances in the path of insight, the eight knowledges of the learner, and the right view of the post-learner.
Why is this?
Because they have the aspects of view and enlightenment.
Those that are neither right view nor the factor of awakening of investigation of phenomena are excluded from the above.

If a dharma has already been established and named, it is classified into the first, second, or third category; if it has not yet been established and named, it is classified into the fourth category.
What are they?
The aggregate of formations is made into these four categories.

The wholesome and contaminated or uncontaminated wisdom of the stage of mental consciousness is classified into the first three categories; the remaining associated and non-associated aggregates of formations are classified into the fourth category; the remaining four aggregates and unconditioned dharmas are also classified into the fourth category. This is called excluding the above.
Are all right knowledges the factor of awakening of investigation of phenomena?
Answer:

Because they have the characteristics of wisdom and the characteristics of the factors of awakening.

As for it is neither right wisdom nor the factor of awakening of investigation of phenomena, except for the above matters as previously explained, here the difference is that all wholesome wisdom of the mental ground and the five consciousnesses, whether contaminated or uncontaminated, are explained.

Question:

Answer:

Furthermore, in order to eliminate right awakening, one seeks the higher stages. If there is right awakening in the higher stages, then the lower stages would not make efforts to seek the higher stages.

If a dharma exists in the lower stages and also exists in the higher stages, then there would be no successive cessation. If there is no successive cessation, then there would be no ultimate cessation.
Why is this?
Because successive cessation can reach ultimate cessation.
If there is no ultimate cessation, then there would be no liberation.
Furthermore, if there is right awakening in bodily actions and verbal actions, then the higher stages would not have bodily actions and verbal actions, and thus there would be no right awakening.
Question:

Answer:

Furthermore, in order to eliminate morality, one seeks the formless realm. If there were morality in the formless realm, then beings in the lower stages would not make efforts to seek the formless realm.
If a dharma exists in a lower realm and also exists in a higher realm, then it has no successive cessation. If it has no successive cessation, then it has no ultimate cessation.
Why is this?
Successive cessation can reach ultimate cessation.
If there is no ultimate cessation, then there is no liberation.
Moreover, precepts are a part of form, and there is no form in the formless realm;

Question:
Since there are no pure four elements, why are there pure precepts?
Answer:

Why is this?
Evil precepts are in the desire realm.
The desire realm is far from the formless realm in four ways:
first, by being far in terms of support;
second, by being far in terms of practice;
third, by being far in terms of objects;
Fourth, in terms of distant counteraction.

The others include the faculty of faith, and among the factors of the path there are right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

If all are said to be included in the factors of the path, or if it is said that apart from right speech and right action there is no separate right livelihood, then the factors of the path have eight names but seven substances.
If it is said that apart from right speech and right action there is a separate right livelihood, then the factors of the path have eight names and eight substances.
